definition: sour grapes
sour/tart/sick at heart/grieved/sore/aching/pedantic/impractical/to make sarcastic remarks about sb/an acid
Portugal/Portuguese/abbr. for 葡萄牙[Pu2 tao2 ya2]
see 葡萄[pu2 tao5]
see 葡萄[pu2 tao5]

sentences.english: Envying those who've made some achievements seems like a case of sour grapes.
sentences.chinese: 嫉妒某人成功有點“酸葡萄”的味道。

sentences.english: There is one thing that China doesn't knowhow to copy from US, that is, sour grapes.
sentences.chinese: 中國有一件東西無法從美國複製，那就是酸葡萄。

sentences.english: But I know it is just sour grapes.
sentences.chinese: 可我知道，那不過是‘酸葡萄’。

sentences.english: A case, perhaps, of sour grapes.
sentences.chinese: 這也算是酸葡萄心理的一例吧。

sentences.english: His snide remarks about the winners are nothing but sour grapes.
sentences.chinese: 他對獲勝者的尖刻評論只不過是狐狸的酸葡萄而已。

sentences.english: She sniffed, a clear case of sour grapes.
sentences.chinese: 她抽了抽鼻子，很明顯一股酸葡萄的味道。

definition: sour grapes (set expr. based on Aesop)/lit. to say grapes are sour when you can't eat them
pinyin: chi1 bu4 dao4 pu2 tao5 shuo1 pu2 tao5 suan1

definition: sour/acid
see 酸不溜丟|酸不溜丢[suan1 bu5 liu1 diu1]
it's all very well to talk, but getting things done is another matter (idiom)/to be an armchair expert/to blabber on
pinyin: zhan4 zhe5 shuo1 hua4 bu4 yao1 teng2

definition: to hate the rich
(Internet slang) sanctimonious bitch
The well-fed cannot know how the starving suffer (idiom).
pinyin: bao3 han4 bu4 zhi1 e4 han4 ji1

definition: plum/CL:個|个[ge4]
harsh/scathing/acid (remarks)
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to comfort oneself/to console oneself/to reassure oneself
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
ugly people will do all kinds of weird things to get attention (idiom)
not the right flavor/not quite right/a bit off/fishy/queer/amiss/feel bad/be upset
(coll.) objectionable/to feel revolted/to gross (sb) out
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
